CSS

Concept's CSS follows modern best practices and techniques. It starts off with Normalize.css, adds minimal styles to base elements, and provides dozens of specialized, modular, prefixed classes.

Typography

All headers h1 through h6 have a default font of Helvetica Neue. All p tags have a default font of Merrieweather Sans. You can easily change these fonts by changing the variables $header-font and $paragraph-font, respectively, in variables.scss.

Paragraph text

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Integer dapibus urna eu urna ornare gravida. Fusce sit amet eros dolor. Vestibulum eget iaculis turpis, ut varius lectus. Duis hendrerit nulla eget lobortis blandit. Morbi semper gravida finibus.

In euismod nec enim sit amet auctor. Sed facilisis ex sed pretium fringilla. Ut auctor dui accumsan, blandit lacus at, eleifend nulla. Mauris at elementum nisi. Donec non venenatis mauris. Vestibulum ultrices odio at est imperdiet, at finibus mauris mollis.

Grid

Concept uses a responsive 12-column grid that can be changed from 1 to 50 columns with the $number-of-columns variable. The grid does not give any default padding or margin to columns or rows. Rather, these styles are added using special classes.

Buttons

Use a variety of classes to build buttons. Start by adding class .c-btn to any <button> or <a> element and add classes as you wish.

Raised button (default)
Flat button
Outline button
Rectangle button
Rounded button
Clicky button
Text button

Success button











Default Button.c-default

The default button is a basic button with white background (#eee), black text (#222), 1px border with same color as the background, and a 2px box-shadow that gives a raised look.




Button Types

Concept provides many alternative types you can use instead of the default raised style. Flat buttons .c-flat remove the box-shadow raised look, outline buttons .c-outline use a transparent background, rectangle buttons .c-rect remove rounded corners, clicky buttons .c-clicky appear pressed when hovered over, and text buttons .c-text appear as simple text and show a background color on hover.





Button Colors

Using a semantic color scheme communicates the function of the button to your users. Use a primary button color .c-primary to communicate importance. It's purple by default and can be changed with $primary-button-background-color. Use a success button .c-success for positive interactive buttons and a danger button .c-danger for negative interactive buttons. Use neutral if you want a nice neutral blue color! Transparent-dark .c-transparent-dark of transparent-light .c-transparent-light buttons are useful for interfaces with a photo background.




Button Sizes

Concept uses five sizes for buttons of dynamic width - extra small .c-xs, small .c-sm, normal (default), large .c-lg, and jumbo .c-jumbo. Fix the width of your button with fixed-width buttons .c-fixed-width or make it super jumbo huge with a full-width button .c-full-width that takes the full width of its containing element.




Button Helpers

Button text is capitalized by default. You can set to back to normal capitalization with .c-capital or lowercase with .c-lowercase.

Input

Forms can be built up in a similar way to buttons. Give every form a class of c-form and add classes based on what type of form you want.

Default Form

Add .c-form-default for the default form, which has a gray background color, lighter gray input fields, and a fixed width. You can add a header to your form with a div inside of class .c-form-title. Use standard Concept buttons classes for submit input elements.

















Full Width Form

Forms are a fixed width by default, controlled by the $form-default-width variable. Forms can be expanded to the full width of their containing element with .c-form-full.
















Modern Form Styles

Add some style to your form with .c-form-lines or .c-form-transparent. These types of lists are best for login screens and screens with a backdrop image. For lines forms, it is recommended not to use placeholders in place of visible input labels.

























Special Input Fields

Concept doesn't add much styling to inputs like radio buttons, checklists, selects. Here's what they look like.

Default Table

Use Concept table styles by adding .c-table to your <table> element. Tables have very basic styles by default - a transparent background and top border for rows.








Table Sizes

Give table rows more breathing room with .c-table-lg or less with .c-table-sm








Table Types

.c-table-pattern will give your table an alternating background-color to rows in your table. Change the background-color with $table-pattern-backgroud-color. Add .c-table-hover for a hovering effect.




Miscellaneous

Links

Default links are given styles based on their parent elements. Inline links within paragraph tags are blue, and have a border-bottom on hover. Links within header tags and <li> tags inherit their color and are not underlined on hover. Add .c-link-list to a list which has links that should take the blue styling.




Lists

By default unordered lists have no padding, margin, or list-style-type. Ordered lists are padded to compensate for the numbers preceding the items. For a standard indented list, add .c-list-indented.
